title: Unable to Create Prospects
custom_steps:
Currently as BOC Admin or Fed Admin  isn't working for creating players from scratch and importing EBIS players by ID or name. The only functionality working  correctly is matching to a WBC player, if the user matches to a WBC player they are able to click "Continue Creating New Player" and create a new or import

When creating new player by name that isn't in WBC or EBIS the page loads but the user isn't directed to the new players profile.

When attempting to match a player by EBIS ID the "No match found" modal is being launched.
Examples used during testing(301715, 371036)

When attempting to match an EBIS player by name the page loads but the user isn't directed to the players profile.

title: Support MFA login with Okta
custom_steps:
Need to provide support for MFA for accounts that are tagged as requiring MFA in Okta. Accounts that are not tagged as requiring MFA will be able to login normally.

AC:
- Upon logging in with an account requiring MFA, user should be presented with an option to push a token.
- After clicking the push button, the user should receive a push on their device
- Once the login is accepted on the device, the user should be logged into WBC

title: Warning Message not firing on Provisional Roster
custom_steps:
Currently the warning/blocker message is not firing, users are able to exceed the Provisional List Max and save successfully.

When a BOC Admin(User 132) attempts to exceed the Provisional List Max warning should fire with an overridable warning and a back button.

When a Fed Team Admin(User 129) attempts to exceed the Provisional List Max a blocking message should fire with a back button.

To Reproduce:
1. Login as BOC Admin or Fed Admin
2. Navigate to the Qualifying Roster tab
3. Add enough players to exceed the Provisional Roster Max (Currently Set to 7)

Expected:
A blocker or warning message fires

Actual:
Users are able to exceed the Provisional List Max and save

title: Create proxy user with min required permission set for Dev, Stg, then Prod
custom_steps:
In order to have production fully operational, we will require a proxy user for ebis and ebislink.

I highly recommend we test a new user (NOT test_boc_approver@mlb.com)  in DEV and STG that has the minimum permissions necessary first, then create a similar user in production once we have tested in the lower systems.

title: As a Team Admin User, I want to upload an PPA to a player on the Provisional Roster
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*

Provisional Roster: [https://zpl.io/VKD5pQW|https://zpl.io/VKD5pQW]

h6. _Note: This story covers the section on the Qualifying Rosters tab and not the Rosters tab, as depicted in the wireframe.  Both tabs will have the same sections._

AC:

* Clicking on the Options Icon on a staff player's row, will launch the options menu, as depicted in the wire
* On the options menu, "player docs" will be an option
* Clicking player docs will launch the upload modal
* You will be able to drag and drop file attachments to the modal
* You will be able to click Browse and open a file browser to attach files
* You will be able to attach multiple files
* There will be a trash can icon for each file attached
** Clicking the trash can will remove the file
* There will be a required label field for attached files
* Label option will be:
** PPA
** Other
* Labelâ€™s may be used more than once
* When a label has been added for all attached files, the Save Documents button will become active
* Clicking save documents will attach the files and commit changes, dismiss the modal, and return a green confirmation message
* Clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm they wish to discard their changes
** If they confirm the decision, their changes will be discarded and the form will reload in view mode
** If they do not confirm the decision, the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.
*

title: Refactor Profile Structure / matching logic
custom_steps:
Tech debt story to represent the work that Zach H. is doing. 



Currently players are represented as a combination of player profile, player, and two mapping tables. Whenever a profile is created all of these must stay in sync in order to retain consistency in our data. This is slightly error-prone and can be refactored.

The goal is to go from 4 objects representing a player to having 1 table represent it. To do so weâ€™ll shift the models focus onto the Profile which we believe represents the basic unit at play in wbc.

Doing so, matching logic will be impacted and will have to change slightly.



AC:

* Everything continues to work as is
** Creating a new Player with and without matches
** Saving Player Profiles

title: Final Roster Rule Check
custom_steps: If a team coordinator is logged in when a BOC user finalizes the roster they're still able to make edits on the qualifying roster page.  A backend rule check should be created to prevent Team Coordinators from making edits to a finalized roster

title: As a BOC User, I want the Rule Checks to Fire when Finalizing the Roster
custom_steps:
AC:

* When the BOC Admin user finalizes a federations roster, rule checks will fire:
** All Players have PPA uploaded
*** Error Message: â€œAll players are required to have a PPA uploadedâ€￾
** All Staff have NPPA uploaded
*** Error Message: â€œAll staff are required to have a NPPA uploadedâ€￾
** Numbers of Players and Staff are above specified Minimums
*** Error Message: â€œThe minimum requirement for staff has not been metâ€￾
** All Pants, Hat, Jersey sizes must be input
*** Error Message: â€œPlayer and/or staff uniform sizes are missingâ€￾
** All Players and Staff must be assigned a number
*** Error Message: â€œPlayer and/or staff uniform numbers are missingâ€￾
* Any failed rule checks will be returned to the user
* The BOC Admin User will have the ability to override any failed rule checks and continue with finalizing the roster

title: Update Player eligibility
custom_steps:
If a player with an eligibility status of pending is removed from the the interest list that status should be removed. Currently if a pending player is removed from the interest list and added again their eligibility status is still "Pending" on their profile, interest list, and eligibility screen. Approved and Denied status should not be changed if the player is removed from the interest list.

To Reproduce:
1. Submit a player on the interest list for eligibility
2. Remove the player from the interest list
3. Add them to the interest list

Expected:
The player is no longer pending

Actual:
The player profile is still pending eligibility

title: Security:  WBC should not require AWS_ACCESS_KEY and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_ID, should be using a role
custom_steps:
According to Rob, we should not be requiring the ACCESS_KEY and ACCESS_ID in order to read/write to S3, we should be using a role instead.    Rob points to lineup cards as one possible example to follow.  

This will block production deployment.  

====

AC:

1.) Roles are created for wbc dev, stg, and prod

2.) Roles are attached to the pod

3.) In dev, stg, and prod s3 buckets, policy allows anyone with the respective role to upload/download

4.) Encryption should continue to work

5.) Upload/download should continue to work as is

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the system to maintain an audit history for each player
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):* 

Player History: [https://zpl.io/anePg3l|https://zpl.io/anePg3l]

* Will log action, timestamp, federation, and username for each action on a player

Actions:

* *Placed on interest list*
** Description: Placed on Interest List
* *Removed from interest list*
** Description: Removed from Interest List
* *Documents uploaded*
** Description: \[label], \[label] uploaded
** Icon: Paperclip (click to download the documents uploaded)
* *Submitted for Eligibility*
** Description: Submitted for Eligibility
* *Eligibility Approved*
** Description: Eligibility Approved
* *Eligibility Denied*
** Description Eligibility Denied
** Icon: Comment bubble (click to view denial reason)
* *Placed on Provisional*
** Description: Placed on Provisional (display â€œ- Qualifying Tournamentâ€￾ if relevant)
* *Removed from Provisional*
** Description: Removed from Provisional (display â€œ- Qualifying Tournamentâ€￾ if relevant)
* *Placed on Final* 
** Description: Added to Final Roster as a \[position block title] (display â€œ- Qualifying Tournamentâ€￾ if relevant)
* *Removed from Final*
** Description: Removed from Final Roster (display â€œ- Qualifying Tournamentâ€￾ if relevant)
